alert.note: Alert for Box Butte; Dawes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:12PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Box Butte and southeastern Dawes Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles north of Wild Horse Butte to near Box Butte Dam. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alliance, Wild Horse Butte, Box Butte Campground and Box Butte Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
